Proxy.name: DataWriterBase
Proxy.Documentation: This defines the interface for legacy vtk data files writer.

IntVectorProperty.name: FileType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The type for the data file (i.e. ascii or binary).

Proxy.name: ParallelWriterBase
Proxy.Documentation: This defines the interface for the parallel writers.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

IntVectorProperty.name: GhostLevel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The number of ghost levels to include in the output file(s). Note that some writers (such as ExodusIIWriter) may not support writing ghost levels.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

IntVectorProperty.label: Write timesteps as file-series
IntVectorProperty.name: WriteTimeSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When WriteTimeSteps is OFF, the writer writes only the current timestep. Otherwise it is called once for each time step within the min and max range. If those are not set, the writer is called for all time steps available in its input.

IntVectorProperty.label: First time step
IntVectorProperty.name: MinTimeStep
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Sets the lower bound for timesteps to write.

IntVectorProperty.label: Last time step
IntVectorProperty.name: MaxTimeStep
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Sets the upper bound for timesteps to write. If less than min, the last time step is used.

IntVectorProperty.label: Time step stride
IntVectorProperty.name: TimeStepStride
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Sets the stride to go through the time steps.

StringVectorProperty.label: File name suffix
StringVectorProperty.name: FileNameSuffix
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The suffix to append to the file name when writing files at different timesteps. (File extensions such as .vtk should be excluded.) The % format specifiers are used. For example, _%d will write files as FileName_0, FileName_1, FileName_2, etc., and _%.3d will write files as FileName_000, FileName_001, FileName_002 etc.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

IntVectorProperty.label: Write all timesteps as file-series
IntVectorProperty.name: WriteTimeSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When WriteTimeSteps is turned ON, the writer is executed once for each timestep available from its input.

IntVectorProperty.label: First time step
IntVectorProperty.name: MinTimeStep
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Sets the lower bound for timesteps to write.

IntVectorProperty.label: Last time step
IntVectorProperty.name: MaxTimeStep
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Sets the upper bound for timesteps to write. If less than min, the last time step is used.

IntVectorProperty.label: Time step stride
IntVectorProperty.name: TimeStepStride
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Sets the stride to go through the time steps.

StringVectorProperty.label: File name suffix
StringVectorProperty.name: FileNameSuffix
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The suffix to append to the file name when writing files at different timesteps. (File extensions such as .vtk should be excluded.) The % format specifiers are used. For example, _%d will write files as FileName_0, FileName_1, FileName_2, etc., and _%.3d will write files as FileName_000, FileName_001, FileName_002 etc.

Proxy.name: CSVWriter
Proxy.Documentation: Writer to write comma or tab delimited files from a table. If the file extension is tsv it uses the tab character for the delimiter. Otherwise it uses a comma.

StringVectorProperty.name: FieldDelimiter
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Used to set the delimiter character. This is hidden from the user and set automatically based on the file extension. An extension of .tsv will set the delimiter character to a tab. Otherwise a comma will be used as the delimiter.

IntVectorProperty.name: FieldAssociation
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Select the attribute data to pass.

IntVectorProperty.name: AddMetaData
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: It is possible for this filter to add additional meta-data to the field data such as point coordinates (when point attributes are selected and input is pointset) or structured coordinates etc. To enable this addition of extra information, turn this flag on.

Documentation.short_help: Write polygonal data in Stanford University PLY format.

IntVectorProperty.name: EnableColoring
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify whether color information should be saved in the PLY file. If enabled, the data source's array to color with from the active view will be used.

IntVectorProperty.name: EnableAlpha
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify whether alpha channel information should be saved in the PLY file. If enabled, the data source's transfer function from the active view will be used. This property is disabled if EnableColoring isn't enabled.

StringVectorProperty.name: ColorArrayName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The array that will be used for saving color information when **Enable Coloring** is ON.

ProxyProperty.name: LookupTable
ProxyProperty.Documentation: Set the lookup table to use for scalar mapping.

Documentation.short_help: Write polygonal data in Wavefront OBJ format.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the file to be written.

Proxy.name: DataSetWriterCore
Proxy.Documentation: Internal proxy used for writing legacy vtk files.

Proxy.name: XMLDataObjectWriterCore
Proxy.Documentation: Internal writer for writing xml-based vtk files.

IntVectorProperty.name: DataMode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The mode uses for writing the file's data i.e. ascii, binary, appended binary.

IntVectorProperty.name: HeaderType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the binary data header word type. The default is UInt32. Set to UInt64 when storing arrays requiring 64-bit indexing.

IntVectorProperty.name: EncodeAppendedData
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When EncodeAppendedData is turned ON, the writer uses base64 encoding when writing binary data (only if appended mode is selected).

IntVectorProperty.name: CompressorType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The compression algorithm used to compress binary data (appended mode only). None offers fastest write, LZ4 offers fastest compressed write, ZLib offers balanced performance, LZMA offers smallest compressed filesize.

IntVectorProperty.name: CompressionLevel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: A compression performance parameter from 1 (faster/larger compressed filesize) to 9 (slower/smaller compressed filesize).

PWriterProxy.name: XMLPPolyDataWriterCore
PWriterProxy.Documentation: Internal writer used to write XML poly data in parallel.

IntVectorProperty.name: GhostLevel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The number of ghost levels to include in the output file(s).

IntVectorProperty.name: UseSubdirectory
IntVectorProperty.label: Store Data in Subdirectory
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls whether the writer puts the files for each piece in the same directory as the pvt* file or in a subdirectory named the same as the pvt* file without its extension

PWriterProxy.name: XMLPUnstructuredGridWriterCore
PWriterProxy.Documentation: Internal writer used to write XML poly data in parallel.

IntVectorProperty.name: GhostLevel
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The number of ghost levels to include in the output file(s).

IntVectorProperty.name: UseSubdirectory
IntVectorProperty.label: Store Data in Subdirectory
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls whether the writer puts the files for each piece in the same directory as the pvt* file or in a subdirectory named the same as the pvt* file without its extension

PWriterProxy.name: XMLPTableCore
PWriterProxy.Documentation: Internal writer used to write XML poly data in parallel.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseSubdirectory
IntVectorProperty.label: Store Data in Subdirectory
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls whether the writer puts the files for each piece in the same directory as the pvt* file or in a subdirectory named the same as the pvt* file without its extension

PWriterProxy.name: XMLPStructuredGridWriterCore
PWriterProxy.Documentation: Internal writer used to write XML poly data in parallel.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseSubdirectory
IntVectorProperty.label: Store Data in Subdirectory
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls whether the writer puts the files for each piece in the same directory as the pvt* file or in a subdirectory named the same as the pvt* file without its extension

PWriterProxy.name: XMLPRectilinearGridWriterCore
PWriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write rectilinear grid in a xml-based vtk data file. Can be used for parallel writing.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseSubdirectory
IntVectorProperty.label: Store Data in Subdirectory
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls whether the writer puts the files for each piece in the same directory as the pvt* file or in a subdirectory named the same as the pvt* file without its extension

PWriterProxy.name: XMLPImageDataWriterCore
PWriterProxy.Documentation: Writer to write image data in a xml-based vtk data file. Can be used for parallel writing.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseSubdirectory
IntVectorProperty.label: Store Data in Subdirectory
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls whether the writer puts the files for each piece in the same directory as the pvt* file or in a subdirectory named the same as the pvt* file without its extension

PWriterProxy.name: XMLPHyperTreeGridWriterCore
PWriterProxy.Documentation: Internal writer used to write XML hyper tree grid data in parallel

IntVectorProperty.name: UseSubdirectory
IntVectorProperty.label: Store Data in Subdirectory
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls whether the writer puts the files for each piece in the same directory as the phtg file or in a subdirectory named the same as the phtg file without its extension
